title.narrative: Leatherback Turtle Monitoring and Conservation as Sasakolo and Litogahira Beaches, Solomon Islands

description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to conduct monitoring of nesting activity and saturation metal and PIT tagging at Sasakolo and Litogahira beaches. The recipient will build increased awareness of and community involvement in leatherback conservation and capacity building of community members. Recipient will work to establish a Litogahira Conservation Area with land owning tribe, similar to the Sasakolo Conservation Area.

person-name.narrative: William Jones; Colleen Holland; Julie Rice; Ry

transaction.usg:treasury-account: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Multinational Species Conservation Fund
U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Multinational Species Conservation Fund

transaction.usg:treasury-account: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Multinational Species Conservation Fund

title.narrative: Expanding Community-based Marine Turtle Conservation in the Solomon Islands

description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to implement a leatherback conservation program in the Solomon Islands. The West Pacific leatherback population has declined rapidly in the last two decades due to overexploitation of eggs and turtles and accidental capture and mortality in gill net fisheries. The intent of this project is to protect nests and nesting females on the beaches of Visunarouru, southeastern Guadalcanal. Activities include: 1) training community members from villages along the southeast Guadalcanal coast in survey and nest protection techniques; 2) develop of sea turtle conservation action plan with community members; and 3) education and awareness of the leatherback conservation status and needs with local communities.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: William Jones; Colleen Holland; Julie Rice; Ry

title.narrative: Community-Based Protection and Monitoring of Leatherback and Hawksbill Turtles in the Western Solomon Islands

description.narrative: 1) conduct nighttime foot patrols on about 10 km of nesting beach on Tetepare, Rendova, and Vangunu Islands to count and protect nests; 2) conduct training workshops fe on sea turtle biology and conservation techniques for field teams to build conservation capacity of rangers and field monitors; and 3) conduct public outreach and education activities to foster greater awareness for the stewardship and conservation of sea turtle populations.

title.narrative: EXPANDING COMMUNITY-BASED CONSERVATION OF MARINE TURTLES IN THE SOLOMON ISLANDS

description.narrative: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO IMPLEMENT A LEATHERBACK CONSERVATION PROGRAM ON THE ON THE BEACHES OF VISUNAROURU, SOUTHEASTERN GUADALCANAL. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: (1) TRAINING COMMUNITY MEMBERS FROM VILLAGES ALONG THE SOUTHEAST GUADALCANAL COAST IN SURVEY AND NEST PROTECTION TECHNIQUES (2) DEVELOPING A SEA TURTLE CONSERVATION ACTION PLAN WITH COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND (3) EDUCATION AND AWARENESS OF THE LEATHERBACK CONSERVATION STATUS AND NEEDS WITH LOCAL COMMUNITIES.

transaction.usg:treasury-account: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Resource Management

title.narrative: COMMUNITY-BASED MARINE TURTLE CONSERVATION: PROTECTION AND MONITORING OF LEATHERBACK, GREEN, AND HAWKSBILL TURTLES IN THE WESTERN SOLOMON ISLANDS

description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to implement community-based nesting beach conservation programs for leatherback, green and hawkbill sea turtles. Activities include: (1) conducting night foot surveys on about 10 km of nesting beach on Tetepare, Rendova, and Vangunu Islands to count and protect nests from poaching and predation; (2) implementing training workshops on sea turtle biology and conservation techniques for field teams to build conservation capacity of rangers and field monitors; and 3) conducting public outreach and education activities to foster greater awareness for the stewardship and conservation of sea turtle populations.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: William Jones; Colleen Holland; Julie Rice; Ry
